original_solution_mapping.L1: 10% + 50% = 60% of the chips in the jar are not green.
original_solution_mapping.L2: So, 100% - 60% = 40% of the chips are green.
original_solution_mapping.L3: There are 40%/10% = 4 sets of 10% to make 40%.
original_solution_mapping.L4: Hence, there are 3 chips x 4 sets = <<3*4=12>>12 green chips.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6670.
    Returns: the number of green chips in the jar.
    """
    # L1
    blue_percentage = 10 # 10% of the entire chips
    white_percentage = 50 # 50% of the chips are white
    non_green_percentage = blue_percentage + white_percentage

    # L2
    total_percentage = 100 # WK
    green_percentage = total_percentage - non_green_percentage

    # L3
    num_sets_of_blue_percentage = green_percentage / blue_percentage

    # L4
    blue_chips_count = 3 # Three blue chips
    green_chips_count = blue_chips_count * num_sets_of_blue_percentage

    # FA
    answer = green_chips_count
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: {blue_percentage}% + {white_percentage}% = {non_green_percentage}% of the chips in the jar are not green.
So, {total_percentage}% - {non_green_percentage}% = {green_percentage}% of the chips are green.
There are {green_percentage}%/{blue_percentage}% = {num_sets_of_blue_percentage} sets of {blue_percentage}% to make {green_percentage}%.
Hence, there are {blue_chips_count} chips x {num_sets_of_blue_percentage} sets = <<{blue_chips_count}*{num_sets_of_blue_percentage}={green_chips_count}>>{green_chips_count} green chips.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: 10% + 50% = 60% of the chips in the jar are not green.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: So, 100% - 60% = 160% of the chips are green.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: There are 160%/10% = 16 sets of 10% to make 160%.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: Hence, there are 3 chips x 16 sets = <<3*16=48>>48 green chips.

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '-' but used '+' instead.
